content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Could you supply and Excel format sheet with the post code (or partial post code) of all licenses currently issued to drivers of Private Hire & Hackney vehicles  issued by Sheffield City Council?
Yours faithfully,
Lee Ward

Dear Lee Ward,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Licensed Private
Hire & Hackney Drivers which we received on 10/07/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 09/08/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear Lee Ward,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Licensed Private
Hire & Hackney Drivers which we received on 10/07/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above. We are sorry we are a little late in
sending you this information.
We are attaching a speadsheet showing the partial postcodes of drivers of
Private Hire & Hackney vehicles issued by Sheffield City Council. Section
40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 allows us to refuse to
provide personal data where disclosure would contravene the data
protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection
Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and
transparent. Section 40(3) allows us to refuse a request if providing the
data would breach one of the data protection principles and in this case
be believe that to give the full postcodes of drivers would mean they
could be identified from that information, which would be unfair
processing.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response. Of
course we acknowledge and apologise for the significant delay in
responding.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Lee Ward <[FOI #1145249 email]>
Sent: Wednesday, July 10, 2024 1:11 PM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - Licensed Private Hire & Hackney
Drivers
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Could you supply and Excel format sheet with the post code (or partial
post code) of all licenses currently issued to drivers of Private Hire &
Hackney vehicles  issued by Sheffield City Council?
Yours faithfully,
Lee Ward
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Please use this email address for all replies to this request:
[4][FOI #1145249 email]
Is [5][Sheffield City Council request email] the wrong address for Freedom
of Information requests to Sheffield City Council? If so, please contact
us using this form:
[6]
https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlo...
Disclaimer: This message and any reply that you make will be published on
the internet. Our privacy and copyright policies:
[7]
https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlo...
For more detailed guidance on safely disclosing information, read the
latest advice from the ICO:
[8]
https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlo...
[9]
https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlo...
Please note that in some cases publication of requests and responses will
be delayed.
If you find this service useful as an FOI officer, please ask your web
manager to link to us from your organisation's FOI page.
show quoted sections

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Licensed Private Hire & Hackney Drivers'.
The request has only supplied some of the post codes,  I have received 997 out of  2912 (according to the SCC public register).
I accept that this could have been a human error in taking the data and adding it to a spread sheet.
A full history of my FOI request and all correspondence is available on the Internet at this address:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/l...
Yours faithfully,
Lee Ward

Dear Lee Ward,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to
Licensed Private Hire & Hackney Drivers which we received on 22/08/2024.
We are sorry to hear that you are not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Freedom of Information Code of Practice states that we should aim to
your request for internal review within 20 working days, by 20/09/2024.
Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you
have any queries.
Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this.
If you have any queries in the meantime, please contact us at the email
address below.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council

emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail
